CatDescriptText: Mr. William King, 8420 Mulberry Way, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I think that there are more raids because it is the people in the neighborhoods who get the police to conduct the raids. It's bad for the 'after-hour joints' to be in operation and this is what causes the raids.  However, it is good for the people to let the police know about the places."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William King wearing tweed baseball cap and light colored short sleeved shirt, standing in front of Thrift Drugs and Kappels, corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown
